title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test your knowledge of recent Greater Boston news stories.
The quiz covers trending stories and events in the Greater Boston area.
Peter Chianca, a general assignment editor since 2019, oversees the quiz content.

title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime goal in the Boston Bruins' 4-3 win against the Buffalo Sabres.
Khusnutdinov was elevated to the top line and played alongside David Pastrnak and Elias Lindholm.
Elias Lindholm exited with a lower-body injury, and Khusnutdinov shifted to center, contributing effectively.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is considered a top NFL MVP contender after leading the Patriots to a 6-2 start.
Former NFL QB Dan Orlovsky argues Maye has outperformed others despite limited offensive support.
Maye's MVP odds are currently third-best at +500, according to DraftKings, behind Mahomes and Allen.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm will host a free farmers market in Jamaica Plain due to the government shutdown affecting SNAP benefits.
The market, held at Loring Greenough House, runs 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. on the first three Thursdays in November.
Gov. Maura Healey announced increased aid to food banks and a new SNAP resource hub to assist affected residents.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: $9,000 in donations stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown after 5:30 p.m. on October 27.
The theft was reported to Watertown police at 8:30 a.m. the following morning.
Police ask anyone with information to contact Detective Joe Kelland at 617-600-1310.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm left the Bruins-Sabres game with a lower-body injury after a collision with Jordan Greenway.
Lindholm has posted four goals and nine points in 12 games this season, contributing significantly to the Bruins' power play.
Coach Marco Sturm noted Marat Khusnutdinov's strong performance as a possible temporary replacement for Lindholm at center.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mookie Betts is struggling with a .130 average in the World Series as the Dodgers face elimination.
David Ortiz advised Betts to focus on enjoying the game, drawing from Little League experiences.
Betts and Dodgers' top-four hitters combined for 1-for-15 in Game 5 against the Blue Jays.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Terence Crosbie, a 39-year-old Irish firefighter, was sentenced to 7-9 years for raping a woman in a Boston hotel.
Crosbie's guilty verdict came after a retrial; an earlier trial in June ended in a mistrial.
Crosbie intends to appeal; his attorney argues the sentence is excessive for a first-time offender.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, a Brockton man from Cape Verde, was sentenced to seven years for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa approached the victim and her sister in Taunton, communicated via Snapchat, and raped her twice in his vehicle.
Barbosa, in the US illegally, fled to Florida but was extradited. He faces potential deportation after serving his sentence.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signed a three-year extension with the Patriots and won AFC Defensive Player of the Month in October.
Jones impressed with key plays, including intercepting Josh Allen and recording a sack in Patriots' win over the Bills.
He ranks third in NFL punt return yards, with standout performances like an 87-yard punt return against the Panthers.
